programme.desc: It’s estimated that roughly 10,000 people are wrongfully convicted in the U.S. each and every year for crimes they didn’t commit. programme.title: One Small Step
programme.desc: Oftentimes climate change and pollution can seem like unfathomably difficult problems to solve. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. Hosted by Lucy Biggers, a growing influencer in the sustainability space.

programme.title: Flying Rivers
programme.desc: From the heart of the Amazon rain forest to our European laboratories, climatologists, biologists and chemists are exploring and are starting to understand a mystery: the central role of forests in cloud formation. Spectacular images will illustrate a strong ecological message and increase awareness of the danger that deforestation represents for our planet.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chesterfield Islands
programme.desc: French cinematographer Christian Pétron takes us on an extraordinary journey of discovery and adventure to unravel the secrets of the Chesterfield Islands. This scientific detective story follows a unique expedition to this remote coral archipelago in the South Pacific, and for the very first time, the stunning underwater world of the Chesterfield Islands is revealed.

programme.title: Bama and the Lost Gorillas
programme.desc: Alfred Bama, an animal keeper from Cameroon, has an extraordinary connection with gorillas. “Nyango,” one of the gorillas he looks after, is the world's only Cross River gorilla in captivity. Until just a few years ago, this species was thought to be extinct. Now, Bama embarks on the greatest challenge of his life: locating Nyango’s family in the wild to protect them before it’s too late.

programme.desc: Ralph’s Iowa buck dreams come true, in a big way, in the last hour of his hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E1 "The Hill"
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E3 - "Blowing the Stuffing Out them"
programme.desc: See Jon Collins on an early morning Coyote stand in Kansas.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E4 "Belly Crawling Bobcat"
programme.desc: Jon Collins’s in Kansas hunting with good friend Jeff Writer. They’re working a thicket in hopes of calling in a bobcat.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E5 "Epic Hunt!!!"
programme.desc: This is one of the most epic stands that the Tooth And Claw crew has ever filmed. Join in with Jon Collins and Jeff Writer where they call in two coyotes and a big tom bobcat on the same stand in Kansas.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E6 "Calling Coyotes In The Early Afternoon - Coyote Hunting"
programme.desc: Join in with Jon Collins and the legendary Jeff Writer on an early afternoon coyote stand.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E7 "Fashionably Late - Coyote Hunting"
programme.desc: Jon Collins and Jeff Writer are still in Kansas grinding out coyote stands. Jump in on the hunt where they call in a big fluffy male coyote.

programme.title: Tooth and Claw S5:E19 "Kicking Up Snow"
programme.desc: Another quick coyote stand! Jon Collins calls in a hard charging coyote in the snow.

programme.title: Road Trips S1:E3 "Cameraman Turned Bowhunter | Brown's Biggest Buck Ever"
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown have been playing cat and mouse with "Big Heavy" throughout their Nebraska trip. During some midday downtime, Brown wins a bet with Jordan on a 50-yard shot to earn himself the right to be in the hot seat. The guys continue making adjustments to get close to the buck. It results in Brown tagging his biggest buck ever.

programme.title: Benelli Presents: Donnie Vincent’s Winds of Adak
programme.desc: In November of 2019, explorer and hunter Donnie Vincent traveled to Adak Island, Alaska. Located at the westernmost end in the Aleutian chain, Adak is wilderness with the exception of a now-abandoned naval base that once housed more than 6,000 people. Winds of Adak chronicles Donnie’s exploration of the island, a hauntingly desolate abandoned military outpost and three unique hunts—caribou, ptarmigan and sea ducks—as the unforgiving elements, the terrain and the Bering Sea test both man and equipment.

programme.title: Silver Kings S6:E3 "Shake N Bake"
programme.desc: Jared is joined by well known tarpon angler Baker Bishop in Islamorada.

programme.title: Silver Kings S6:E4 "Bridges"
programme.desc: Jared and Brent Flack-Davidson, from New York, battle it out with a beast in Islamorada.

programme.title: Rack Daddies S5:E3 "Pennsylvania Opener"
programme.desc: As the guys prep for the PA archery season, we welcome two new members onto the team, Tyler Maiman and Trey Pritchard! That magical opening day morning arrives and an awesome PA buck is knocked down. Trevor and Townsley are putting some time in the stand and Trevor knocks down his first deer with his bow ever!

programme.title: Rack Daddies S5:E4 "Eastern Shore Part I"
programme.desc: Its the opening weekend on the Eastern Shore but there’s just one problem, Hurricane Dorian is about to hit the coast. The guys brave the storm as they hunt in very windy conditions, then Trey manages to send a meat missile through his biggest buck to date!

programme.title: Rack Daddies S5:E5 "2019 Squirrel Classic"
programme.desc: The Squirrel Classic has long been a tradition with Rack Daddies, dating back to Season One. This year however, we stepped it up BIG TIME, inviting 4 teams to compete in the annual competition to fight for the title of Squirrel Classic Champion 2019!! Lots of fun, lots of laughs and lots of squirrels to chase!

programme.title: No Limits Hunting S7:E3 "Black Gold"
programme.desc: Alexis and Brian are hunting with their good friends at Limcroma Safaris in South Africa in pursuit of Black Impala, Golden Wildebeest, and Gemsbok.

programme.title: No Limits Hunting S7:E4 "Bows and Guns"
programme.desc: Alexis, Greg Mott and Matt Jensen are back in South Africa Hunting at Limcroma Safaris.

programme.title: Local Knowledge S6:E3 "If This Boat Could Talk"
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge S6:E4 "Gulffish”
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Drew Barth - Shoulda Tried Harder
programme.desc: Drew Barth is one of the fastest rising comedy stars in the Northwest. Born just outside the city of Seattle, what started as a dare in high school has become a full-time career. Drew Barth has risen through the ranks of local open mics to become a regular performer at comedy clubs, colleges, casinos and private events up and down the West Coast. After making the finals of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Drew Barth spent a great deal of time in Los Angeles performing at clubs such as The Comedy Store, Laugh Factory, and The Improv, honing his craft.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Seth Tippetts - Tall. Dark. Gigante
programme.desc: Get to know Seth from the chest down. He’s big, he’s tall, but most of all he’s hilarious. Check out this Utah-raised, clean, and semi-professional comedian today!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jeff Capri - Capricious
programme.desc: Jeff Capri uses his cynical perspective to riff on oxygen bars, playing darts to get in shape, and men taking their shirts off before fights.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Michael Palascak - 1984
programme.desc: Michael Palascak's dry humor shines with riffs on interviewing for a pyramid scheme, living with his parents after college, and how life is way better now than in 1984.

programme.title: Collin Moulton - Anti-Animal Vegan
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jordan Makin - The BFFG
programme.desc: Born and raised in the heart of Utah County, Jordan Makin had to compensate for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny. His unique observations will make you laugh and his stories about feeling awkward will help you appreciate your life more. He has worked with many comedy greats, such as Marc Maron, Ryan Hamilton, and Drew Lynch. His comedy has been featured at the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival and the Idaho Laugh Fest. Jordan is the co-creator and co-host of The Happy Valley Podcast.

programme.title: Ron Ruhman - Weird Stuff
programme.desc: Ron has been called a “High Energy Seinfeld”. He brings a very energetic style to the stage as he shares his interesting slant on day-to-day life in an act that is clean, smart, and very entertaining.

programme.title: James Johann - Rurally Funny
programme.desc: James' childhood upbringing was significantly influenced by country music, countless bad hair cuts, and Catholic school. In 1991, James began his stand-up career in Kansas City. Today, James is a long-time veteran of the stand-up comedy circuit, performing at clubs across the country. His self-deprecating sense of humor and high energy style come together to create a unique onstage persona. James relies more on his brain than the profane and his comedy is a truthful and hilarious reflection of life as he sees it.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Aaron Woodall - Sad and Needy
programme.desc: Between his first and second special, Aaron Woodalls perspective transitioned from a nice young man coming to grips with a dirty, cynical world to a deeper introspection of his own upbringing and biases.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Tom Ryan - Off The Verge
programme.desc: Over the years Tom Ryan has worked steadily at comedy clubs, concert venues, corporate functions and colleges across the U.S.. He has also made national television appearances on Showtime, A&E Comedy Central, and… Three times on “The Late Show with David Letterman!”. He has performed as the opening act in concert for: B.B. King, Tim Allen, Steven Wright, Natalie Cole, and Dennis Miller just to name a few. He has contributed monologue jokes to the award winning "Politically Incorrect with Bill Maher" and regularly headlines corporate events for companies ranging from Coca-Cola to Church and Dwight. Tom believes that the best comedy comes from the most unlikely sources.

programme.desc: In-demand stand up comedian known for his machine gun approach and hilarious, clean material.

programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. Our brains grew significantly once the human race started hunting its food. Diets that consisted of blood, guts, and organs contributed to that growth. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.
